On Friday 29 March 2002 03:35 am, you wrote:
> Visual Basic is what I recall DPH writing it in :)
>

yea that's what I thougt I remembered too, but never having used it I wasn't 
sure.

> No comments are needed because it is really simple to understand what is
> going on - some conditions are checked on an object, and if met that object
> is modified a little.
>

It's my oppinion that code should always have comments, no matter how simple 
it is, but maybe that's just me.  I really only glanced over it; didn't try 
to figgure out what it was doing at all.
